Michael Stack writes:
> Do '$MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven -g' to see possible targets.
> 
> For what you're doing, looks like you want '$MAVEN_HOME/bin/maven jar'.  
> This will build a heritrix jar into your target directory.
> 
> (I just tested with maven rc2 and maven rc1 and the jar target works for 
> both. I know that if you try to do any more than build jars, if you want 
> to build the doc. or a distribution or generate the heritrix website, 
> there'll be probs as has been reported on this list in the past.  Only 
> HEAD works for sure with rc2).

I was able to build (and hack) Heritrix 0.8.0 using maven rc2, FWIW,
on my Mac OS X box.

I extended FetchHTTP.java to look for the environment
HERITRIX_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE and set the AcceptLanguage: header to its
value. I have fully come to terms with how to hook this up into
Heritrix's preferences system or the UI, so this works for the time being.

    -tree

P.S. And I'm working on learning Eclipse --- what a *cool* project.

--
